'Freddie Mercury' (born 'Farrokh Bulsara'; Gujarati: àª«àª°à«àª àª¬àª²à«àª¸àª¾àª°àª¾â, PharÅkh
BalsÄrÄâ); 5 September 1946 â 24 November 1991) [http://mr-
mercury.co.uk/Images/Birthcertificatefreddie.jpg Birth certificate] mr-
mercury.co.uk was a British musician, singer, and songwriter, best known as the lead
vocalist and lyricist of the rock band Queen. As a performer, he was known for
his flamboyant stage persona and powerful vocals over a four-octave range. -
[http://web.archive.org/web/20110615085921/http://entertainment.time-
sonline.co.uk/tol/arts_and_entertainment/article675005.ece Dance: Deux the
fandango] via Internet Archive. [http://www.rollingstone.com/music/lists/6027/32782
RollingStone.com â 100 Greatest Singers of All Time]. As a songwriter,
Mercury composed many hits for Queen, including "Bohemian Rhapsody", "Killer
Queen", "Somebody to Love", "Don't Stop Me Now", "Crazy Little Thing Called
Love", and "We Are the Champions". In addition to his work with Queen, he led a
solo career, and also occasionally served as a producer and guest musician
(piano or vocals) for other artists. He died of bronchopneumonia brought on by
AIDS on 24 November 1991, only one day after publicly acknowledging that he had
the disease.

Mercury was a Parsi born in Zanzibar and grew up there and in India until his
mid-teens. He has been referred to as "Britain's first Asian rock star". In 2002, Mercury was placed at number 58 in the BBC's
poll of the 100 Greatest Britons, in 2006, [[Time Asia]] named him one of the
most influential Asian heroes of the past 60 years, and he continues to be voted one of the greatest singers in
the history of popular music. In 2005, a poll organised by [[Blender
(magazine)|Blender]] and MTV2 saw Mercury voted the greatest male singer of all
time. [http://www.amiannoying.com/(S(wwb0os55dj4oeh45sg3hgt3g))/collection.-
aspx?collection=534 list] of [[Blender (magazine)|Blender]] and MTV2's "22
Greatest Voices" (archived at www.amiannoying.com). In 2008, [[Rolling
Stone]] editors ranked him number 18 on their list of the 100 greatest singers
of all time. In 2009, a [[Classic Rock
(magazine)|Classic Rock]] poll saw him voted the greatest rock singer of all
time. [[Classic Rock (magazine)|Classic Rock]], "50 Greatest
Singers in Rock", May 2009 Allmusic has characterised Mercury as "one of
rock's greatest all-time entertainers", who possessed "one of the greatest
voices in all of music". |title=Freddie Mercury biography |work=AllMusic
|accessdate=24 January 2011}}
categories: Indian emigrants to the United Kingdom
